item.title: Barrett add a quote by Allan E. Goodman
item.description: "As in the case of the economy, an 'invisible hand' will often be a better cultivator of ideas and allocator of effort. The challenge for intelligence officials in the Information Age is to understand how to integrate these indirect mechanisms into their operations" -- Allan E. Goodman

item.title: Barrett add a quote by Aleister Crowley
item.description: "30. If Will stops and cries Why, invoking Because, then Will stops & does nought. 31. If Power asks why, then is Power weakness." -- Aleister Crowley

item.title: Barrett add a quote by Jeff Somers
item.description: "I forced myself to stay put and keep looking-impatient assholes would take the leap, letting adrenaline and desperation guide them, but I was fucking ancient and I knew better. It was bitter, but I fucking knew better about just about everything." -- Jeff Somers

item.title: Barrett add a quote by Milorad Pavić
item.description: "Each of us promenades his thought, like a monkey on a leash. When you read, you always have to such monkeys: your own and one belonging to someone else. Or, even worse, a monkey and a hyena. Now, consider what you will feed them. For a hyena does not eat the same things as a monkey..." -- Milorad Pavić

item.title: Barrett add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "Yet magic is no more the art of employing consciously invisible means to produce visible effects. Will, love, and imagination are magic powers that everyone possesses; and whoever knows how to develop them to their fullest extent is a magician. Magic has but one dogma, namely, that the seen is the measure of the unseen." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Barrett add a quote by Robert Ludlum
item.description: "Well, let me tell you, gentlemen, the games of the devil are not restricted to those confined to hell. Others can play them." -- Robert Ludlum

item.title: Barrett add a quote by Thomas Harris
item.description: "It's hard to have anything isn't it? Rare to get it, hard to keep it. This is a damn slippery planet." -- Thomas Harris

item.title: Barrett add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "There is only one thing that I dread: not to be worthy of my sufferings." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Barrett add a quote by John le Carré
item.description: "The more identities a man has, the more they express the person they conceal." -- John le Carré

item.title: Barrett add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "The problem with introspection is that it has no end." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Barrett add a quote by A. L. Barabasi
item.description: "The distribution of routers on the map of North America forms a fractal set, a self-similar mathematical object..." -- A. L. Barabasi

item.title: Barrett add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "There is no disaster greater than not being content; There is no misfortune greater than being covetous." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Barrett add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "I have no money, no resources, no hopes. I am the happiest man alive." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Barrett add a quote by John Berendt
item.description: "Black magic never stops. What goes from you comes to you. Once you start this shit, you gotta keep it up. Just like the utility bill. Just like the grocery store. Or they kill you. You got to keep it up. Two, five, ten, twenty years." -- John Berendt

item.title: Barrett add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "Yossarian decided to change the subject. "Now you're changing the subject." he pointed out diplomatically. "I'll bet I can name two things to be miserable about for every one you can name to be thankful for." -- Joseph Heller

item.title: Barrett add a quote by John le Carré
item.description: "I honestly do wonder, without wishing to be morbid, how I reached this present pass. So far as I can ever remember of my youth, I chose the secret road because it seemed to lead straightest and furthest toward my... goal... Today, all I know is that I have learned to interpret the whole of life in terms of conspiracy... These people terrify me, but I am one of them. If they stab me in the back, then at least that is the judgement of my peers." -- John le Carré

item.title: Barrett add a quote by John Berendt
item.description: "By morning she was dead. She had not died of starvation or committed suicide by any conventional means. She had simply willed herself to die, and being a strong-willed woman, she had succeeded. She had missed dying on her birthday by two days." -- John Berendt

item.title: Barrett add a quote by William Gibson
item.description: "And, for an instant, she stared directly into those soft blue eyes and knew, with an instinctive mammalian certainty, that the exceedingly rich were no longer even remotely human." -- William Gibson

item.title: Barrett add a quote by Eric Ambler
item.description: "Yet, when these facts are seen side by side with other facts in the case, it is difficult not to become lost in superstitious awe. Their very absurdity seems to prohibit the use of the words 'chance' and 'coincidence.' For the sceptic there remains only one consolation: if there should be such a thing as superhuman Law, it is administered with sub-human inefficiency." -- Eric Ambler

item.title: Barrett add a quote by John le Carré
item.description: "...also took for granted that secret services were the only real measure of a nations political health, the only real expression of its subconscious." -- John le Carré

item.title: Barrett add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Turning to me, he said, "Take away your hand; it has deceived you. The road of the Tradition is not for the chosen few. It is everyone's road. And the power that you think you have is worthless, because it is a power that is shared by all. You should have refused your sword. If you had done so, it would have been given to you, because you would have shown that your heart was pure. But just as I feared, at the supreme moment you stumbled and fell. Because of your avidity, you will now have to seek again for your sword. And because of your pride, you will have to seek it among simple people. Because of your fascination with miracles, you will have to struggle to recapture what was about to be given to you so generously." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Barrett add a quote by William Gibson
item.description: "The faces he woke up with in the worlds hotels were like God's own hood ornaments. Women's sleeping faces, identical and alone, naked, aimed straight out to the void." -- William Gibson

item.title: Barrett add a quote by Neal Asher
item.description: "Cormac was completely aware that he was being manipulated, but how he could not see. He reckoned that when he did find out, the surprise would be a nasty one. That was how it usually went." -- Neal Asher

item.title: Barrett add a quote by William Gibson
item.description: "...I knew he used women as counters in a game, Bobby Quine versus time and the night of cities. And Rikki had turned up just when he needed something to get him going, something to aim for. So he'd set her up as a symbol for everything he wanted and couldn't have, everything he'd had and couldn't keep." -- William Gibson

item.title: Barrett add a quote by Thomas Harris
item.description: "It's fear, Jack. The man deals with a huge amount of fear.' Because he got hurt?' No, not entirely. Fear comes with imagination, it's a penalty, it's the price of imagination." -- Thomas Harris

item.title: Barrett add a quote by Robert Ludlum
item.description: "A man's weaknesses may intrude on his faith but they do not diminish it." -- Robert Ludlum

item.title: Barrett add a quote by Victor Frankl
item.description: "An abnormal reaction to an abnormal situation is normal behavior." -- Victor Frankl

item.title: Barrett add a quote by Alcoholics Anonymous World Services
item.description: "We have learned that the satisfaction of instincts cannot be the sole aim of our lives." -- Alcoholics Anonymous World Services

item.title: Barrett add a quote by Lucanus
item.description: "God cheats men into living on by hiding how blessed it is to die." -- Lucanus

item.title: Barrett add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "Some men are born mediocre, some men achieve mediocrity, and some men have mediocrity thrust upon them. With Major Major it had been all three. Even among men lacking all distinction he inevitably stood out as a man lacking more distinction than all the rest, and people who met him were always impressed by how unimpressive he was." -- Joseph Heller
